description: Describes your NAT gateways. The default is to describe all your NAT gateways. Alternatively, you can specify specific NAT gateway IDs or filter the results to include only the NAT gateways that match specific criteria.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. nat-gateway-id - The ID of the NAT gateway. state - The state of the NAT gateway ( pending | failed | available | deleting | deleted). subnet-id - The ID of the subnet in which the NAT gateway resides. tag - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value. vpc-id - The ID of the VPC in which the NAT gateway resides. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

parameters.name: NatGatewayIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the NAT gateways. (string) ---

nested_items.name: NatGateways
nested_items.description: Information about the NAT gateways.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the NAT gateway was created.

nested_items.name: DeleteTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the NAT gateway was deleted, if applicable.

nested_items.name: FailureCode
nested_items.description: If the NAT gateway could not be created, specifies the error code for the failure. ( InsufficientFreeAddressesInSubnet | Gateway.NotAttached | InvalidAllocationID.NotFound | Resource.AlreadyAssociated | InternalError | InvalidSubnetID.NotFound)

nested_items.name: FailureMessage
nested_items.description: If the NAT gateway could not be created, specifies the error message for the failure, that corresponds to the error code.
For InsufficientFreeAddressesInSubnet: 'Subnet has insufficient free addresses to create this NAT gateway'
For Gateway.NotAttached: 'Network vpc-xxxxxxxx has no Internet gateway attached'
For InvalidAllocationID.NotFound: 'Elastic IP address eipalloc-xxxxxxxx could not be associated with this NAT gateway'
For Resource.AlreadyAssociated: 'Elastic IP address eipalloc-xxxxxxxx is already associated'
For InternalError: 'Network interface eni-xxxxxxxx, created and used internally by this NAT gateway is in an invalid state. Please try again.'
For InvalidSubnetID.NotFound: 'The specified subnet subnet-xxxxxxxx does not exist or could not be found.'

nested_items.name: NatGatewayAddresses
nested_items.description: Information about the IP addresses and network interface associated with the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: AllocationId
nested_items.description: [Public NAT gateway only] The allocation ID of the Elastic IP address that's associated with the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the network interface associated with the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: PrivateIp
nested_items.description: The private IP address associated with the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: PublicIp
nested_items.description: [Public NAT gateway only] The Elastic IP address associated with the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: AssociationId
nested_items.description: [Public NAT gateway only] The association ID of the Elastic IP address that's associated with the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: IsPrimary
nested_items.description: Defines if the IP address is the primary address.

nested_items.name: FailureMessage
nested_items.description: The address failure message.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The address status.

nested_items.name: NatGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedBandwidth
nested_items.description: Reserved. If you need to sustain traffic greater than the documented limits, contact Amazon Web Services Support.

nested_items.name: ProvisionTime
nested_items.description: Reserved.

nested_items.name: Provisioned
nested_items.description: Reserved.

nested_items.name: RequestTime
nested_items.description: Reserved.

nested_items.name: Requested
nested_items.description: Reserved.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Reserved.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the NAT gateway.
pending: The NAT gateway is being created and is not ready to process traffic.
failed: The NAT gateway could not be created. Check the failureCode and failureMessage fields for the reason.
available: The NAT gateway is able to process traffic. This status remains until you delete the NAT gateway, and does not indicate the health of the NAT gateway.
deleting: The NAT gateway is in the process of being terminated and may still be processing traffic.
deleted: The NAT gateway has been terminated and is no longer processing traffic.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet in which the NAT gateway is located.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC in which the NAT gateway is located.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags for the NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: ConnectivityType
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the NAT gateway supports public or private connectivity.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
